subject: Re: [junit] can anyone help me to resolve my problem,
msgSnippet: Rajesh, I take it there s not a useful equals method on Document to give you what you want.  Darn.  (One thing I like about JUnit is that I m much more likely
messageBody:
Rajesh,

I take it there's not a useful equals method on Document to give you
what you want. Darn. (One thing I like about JUnit is that I'm much
more likely to have good equals methods on my classes).

In that case, what features of the Document would you have to compare to
be sure that they represented the same value? Could you write a
documentsAreEqual(Document a, Document b) method, and assert on that?

David Saff

Rajesh K wrote:

> can anyone help me to resolve my problem,
>
> acually i m having one method which returns org.jdom.Document object.
>
> i want to check whether the returned object having the value what we
> expecting
>
> i tried like
>
> assertEquals(org.jdom.Document expected, returning object)
>
> but the object having different memory location, so that we can't test
> like this.
>
> then how? plzzzzzzzzz
>
>
